alert.note: Alert for Wahkiakum (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued November 04 at 3:24AM PDT until November 05 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Portland OR has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... Grays River near Rosburg affecting Wahkiakum County. .Heavy rain associated with a strong atmospheric river will occur across southwest Washington today, with forecast rainfall amounts ranging from 3 to 6 inches through late this evening. This will lead to rapid rises on area rivers. Rain will taper off to showers tonight and Saturday, with another round of heavier rain expected Saturday night into Sunday morning. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Grays River near Rosburg. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late tonight. * IMPACTS...Above 12.0 feet, expect some flooding of roads along and near the Grays River, including roadway approaches to the Altoona Bridge over the Grays, and portions of Covered Bridge Road, Barr-Durrah Road, and Loop Road near Rosburg and Hwy 4. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 AM PDT Friday the stage was 5.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is forecast to rise slightly above flood stage of 12.0 feet late this afternoon. It is then forecast to fall below flood stage around midnight tonight and recede to around 9.0 feet by Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon by 400 PM PDT.
